test_categories.qa_coverage: Tests that Q&A pairs are working correctly for common questions
test_categories.rag_capability: Tests that RAG can handle variations WITHOUT Q&A pairs
test_categories.real_world: Realistic user questions that test the full system

test_questions.question: What's the total cost per year for my child?
test_questions.note: Annual calculation - no Q&A pair exists

test_questions.question: How much do I pay each month including all fees?
What are my out-of-pocket expenses?
test_questions.note: Tests 'all costs' without exact Q&A match

test_questions.question: Tell me about your insurance requirements
What time should I drop off my 6 year old?
test_questions.expected_answer: Should infer from age group schedule
test_questions.note: Requires inference from age to schedule

test_questions.question: When is tuition due each month?
test_questions.note: Specific detail not in Q&A pairs

test_questions.question: My daughter is 8, how much will this cost me total?
test_questions.note: Combines age, schedule, and cost questions

test_questions.question: I want to start a TSA school, what are the startup costs?
test_questions.note: Natural coach question about getting started

test_questions.question: Do you take credit cards or just checks?
Tell me everything about costs
test_questions.note: Answer MUST be different for parent vs coach

test_questions.question: Do you have a basketball team?
test_questions.note: Should not hallucinate sports not offered

test_questions.question: What happens if I'm late?
test_questions.expected_answer: Late pickup fee OR late payment fee
test_questions.note: Ambiguous - could mean pickup or payment

anti_gaming_rules.forbidden_source_check: If forbidden_source is set, test MUST fail if that source is used
anti_gaming_rules.variation_requirement: RAG capability tests should use different phrasings than Q&A pairs
anti_gaming_rules.real_world_priority: Real world tests are most important - they reflect actual usage
